Non-performing financing receivables represent receivables for which we have stopped accruing finance income. This generally occurs when receivables are 90 days delinquent.
tables.context: ●Past due balances represent any payments 30 days or more past the due date.

rows: Write-offs generally occur when receivables are 120 days delinquent. In these situations, the estimated uncollectible amount is written off to the allowance for credit losses. Any expected recovery is presented as non-performing.
tables.context: ●Non-performing financing receivables represent receivables for which we have stopped accruing finance income. This generally occurs when receivables are 90 days delinquent.

Production systems: A strategic alignment of products and solutions around our customers’ operations.
tables.context: We announced the Smart Industrial Operating Model in 2020. This operating model is based on three focus areas:

rows: Technology stack: Investments in technology, as well as research and development, that deliver intelligent solutions to our customers through digital capabilities, automation, autonomy, and alternative power technologies.
tables.context: (a)Production systems: A strategic alignment of products and solutions around our customers’ operations.

rows: Lifecycle solutions: The integration of our aftermarket and support capabilities to more effectively manage customer equipment, service, and technology needs across the full lifetime of a John Deere product.
tables.context: (b)Technology stack: Investments in technology, as well as research and development, that deliver intelligent solutions to our customers through digital capabilities, automation, autonomy, and alterna

rows: We expect large and small agricultural equipment sales to be down from 2023 levels in North America, Europe, and South America.
tables.context: Agriculture and Turf Outlook for 2024

rows: Agricultural fundamentals across all our major markets are expected to moderate in 2024 due to rising global stocks, lower commodity prices, elevated interest rates, and weather volatility. In the U.S. and Canada, this is partially offset by resilient farm balance sheets.
tables.context: ●We expect large and small agricultural equipment sales to be down from 2023 levels in North America, Europe, and South America.

rows: The U.S. equipment fleet age is elevated for both tractors and combines. However, increases in used inventory levels are impacting purchasing decisions.
tables.context: ●Agricultural fundamentals across all our major markets are expected to moderate in 2024 due to rising global stocks, lower commodity prices, elevated interest rates, and weather volatility. In the U.

rows: In Europe, the dairy and livestock sector is expected to improve due to stronger pricing amid lower feed costs while spring weather conditions have caused uncertainty about winter seeded crop yields. In addition, persistent, elevated input costs have decreased demand in Europe.
tables.context: ●The U.S. equipment fleet age is elevated for both tractors and combines. However, increases in used inventory levels are impacting purchasing decisions.

rows: Demand in Brazil is expected to be down due to strong global yields driving down commodity prices, adverse weather conditions, and high interest rates.
tables.context: ●In Europe, the dairy and livestock sector is expected to improve due to stronger pricing amid lower feed costs while spring weather conditions have caused uncertainty about winter seeded crop yields.

rows: Industry sales in Asia are forecasted to be down moderately due to commodity price changes, inventory reductions, and weather impacts.
tables.context: ●Demand in Brazil is expected to be down due to strong global yields driving down commodity prices, adverse weather conditions, and high interest rates.

rows: Due to macro-economic trends in U.S. consumer markets including lower levels of home sales, persistently higher interest rates, and inventory reductions, sales of compact utility tractors and riding lawn equipment continue to be lower.
tables.context: ●Industry sales in Asia are forecasted to be down moderately due to commodity price changes, inventory reductions, and weather impacts.

rows: Benefits from increasing U.S. infrastructure spending, elevated manufacturing investment levels, and improving single family housing starts are expected to partially offset declines in commercial real estate construction and softening rental demand.
tables.context: ●Construction equipment industry sales are forecasted to be flat to down from 2023 levels.
Financial Services Outlook for 2024

Net income attributable to Deere & Company

Higher for the first six months due to investment income earned on international mutual funds securities.
Higher due to continued focus on developing and incorporating technology solutions.

Lower in the second quarter as the prior period was impacted by the cumulative correction of the accounting treatment for financing incentives offered to John Deere dealers of $173 pretax ($135 after-tax). Excluding the impact of this item, selling, administrative and general expenses have increased for both periods mostly due to a higher provision for credit losses and higher employee pay driven by inflationary conditions and profit sharing incentives.
Increased for both periods primarily due to higher average borrowing rates and higher average borrowings.
Lower in the second quarter due to higher pension benefits (see Note 6) and lower foreign exchange losses.
Decreased for both periods as a result of lower pretax income.

tables.context: Purchases of our common stock during the second quarter of 2024 were as follows:

rows: We have a share repurchase plan that was announced in December 2022 to purchase up to $18.0 billion of shares of our common stock. The maximum number of shares that may yet be purchased under this plan was 26.8 million based on the closing price of our common stock on the New York Stock Exchange as of the end of the second quarter of 2024 of $393.33 per share. At the end of the second quarter of 2024, $10.5 billion of common stock remained to be purchased under this plan.
